revealed_symptoms.ulceration: It’s like a cut or sore that just won’t heal, and sometimes it scabs over but comes right back.
revealed_symptoms.border irregularity: The edges are all jagged, kinda messy, not smooth like my other moles.
revealed_symptoms.satellite lesions: There are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.
revealed_symptoms.induration: It feels thicker or harder than the rest of my skin, like there's something under there.
revealed_symptoms.asymmetry: One side of this mole looks different from the other, like it's lopsided or uneven.
revealed_symptoms.spontaneous bleeding: Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.

hidden_symptoms.diameter >6mm: It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing.
hidden_symptoms.color variation: It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in.
hidden_symptoms.evolving: This thing keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before.
hidden_symptoms.erythema: The skin around it looks red or puffy, like it’s irritated or reacting to something.
hidden_symptoms.shiny or waxy bump: It looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away.
hidden_symptoms.telangiectasia: There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before.

patient_history.content: Hi, I'll be your doctor today. What brings you in?

Well, doc, I’ve got this spot that's really bothering me. It’s like a cut or sore that just won’t heal, and sometimes it scabs over but comes right back. The edges are all jagged, kinda messy, not smooth like my other moles. There are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading, and one side of it looks different from the other, like it's lopsided or uneven. The skin around the spot feels thicker or harder than the rest of my skin, like there's something under there. Sometimes it just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.

Thank you for sharing that information. To get a better understanding of the spot, can you tell me how long this spot has been there? Has it always looked like this, or have you noticed any changes over time? Also, does it itch or hurt at all?

I’ve noticed the spot for a while now, and it definitely hasn't always looked like this. It’s been changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before. It doesn’t really itch, but sometimes it feels a little sore, but not always.
Thank you. Have you ever had any other similar spots or skin problems before? Does anyone in your family have a history of skin cancer?
No, I haven’t had anything like this before. And, as far as I know, nobody in my family has ever had skin cancer.
Okay, thank you. Can you tell me about your sun exposure? Do you spend a lot of time outdoors? Have you ever had sunburns, and if so, how severe were they?
I work outside a lot, so I get a fair amount of sun. I've definitely had sunburns before, some pretty bad ones where my skin peeled.
Thank you for sharing that information. Can you tell me where this spot is located on your body?

The edges are all jagged, kinda messy, not smooth like my other moles. There are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading, and one side of it looks different from the other, like it's lopsided or uneven. The skin around the spot feels thicker or harder than the rest of my skin, like there's something under there. Sometimes it just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.
